citing_paper_authors: Sandra, Aluísio | Lucia, Specia | Caroline, Gasperin | Carolina, Scarton
raw_text: Pitler and Nenkova (2008) propose a unified framework composed of vocabulary, syntactic, elements of lexical cohesion, entity coherence and discourse relations to measure text quality, which resembles the composition of rubrics in the area of essay scoring (Burstein et al, 2003)
clean_text: Pitler and Nenkova (2008) propose a unified framework composed of vocabulary, syntactic, elements of lexical cohesion, entity coherence and discourse relations to measure text quality, which resembles the composition of rubrics in the area of essay scoring (Burstein et al, 2003).

citing_paper_authors: Felice, Dell'Orletta | Simonetta, Montemagni | Giulia, Venturi
raw_text: The last few years have been characterised by approaches based on the com bi nation of features ranging over different linguistic levels, namely lexical, syntactic and discourse (see e.g. Pitler and Nenkova (2008), Kate (2010)) .Another important factor determining the typology of features to be considered for assessing read ability has to do with the intended audience of readers: it is commonly agreed that reading ease does not follow from intrinsic text properties alone, but it is also affected by the expected audience. Among the studies addressing readability with respect to specific audiences, it is worth mentioning here: Schwarm and Ostendorf (2005) and Heilman et al (2007) dealing with language learners, or Feng (2009 )focussing on people with mild intellectual disabilities

citing_paper_authors: Felice, Dell'Orletta | Simonetta, Montemagni | Giulia, Venturi
raw_text: Feng (2009) propose a set of cognitively motivated features operating at the discourse level specifically addressing the cognitive characteristics of the expected users. When readability is targeted towards adult competent language users a more prominent role is played by discourse features (Pitler and Nenkova, 2008)
clean_text: When readability is targeted towards adult competent language users a more prominent role is played by discourse features (Pitler and Nenkova, 2008).

citing_paper_authors: Felice, Dell'Orletta | Simonetta, Montemagni | Giulia, Venturi
raw_text: This feature has already been shown to be a reliable indicator for automatic readability assessment (see, for example, Pitler and Nenkova (2008) and Aluisio et al (2010))

raw_text: Nevertheless, recent works in the NLP community investigating the impact of entity grids (Barzilay and Lapata, 2008) or of discourse relations (Pitler and Nenkova, 2008) on text coherence and readability go in the same direction as research onCoh-Metrix, in that they aim at identifying the linguistic features that best express readability at syn tactic, semantic and discourse level
clean_text: Nevertheless, recent works in the NLP community investigating the impact of entity grids (Barzilay and Lapata, 2008) or of discourse relations (Pitler and Nenkova, 2008) on text coherence and readability go in the same direction as research on Coh-Metrix, in that they aim at identifying the linguistic features that best express readability at syntactic, semantic and discourse level.
